data.enText: a surface or piece of land that slopes (= is higher at one end than the other)
a grassy slope
The town is built on a slope .
an area of land that is part of a mountain or hill
the eastern slopes of the Andes
ski slopes

data.chText: 整个冬天他都在山坡上滑雪。
data.enText: He spends all winter on the slopes (= skiing ) .
the amount by which sth slopes
a gentle/steep slope
a slope of 45 degrees
the angle of slope
the/a slippery slope

data.chText: 使人滑向深渊的斜坡；危险的境地
data.enText: a course of action that is difficult to stop once it has begun, and can lead to serious problems or disaster
to be at an angle so that it is higher at one end than the other
The garden slopes away towards the river.
sloping shoulders
to be at an angle rather than being straight or vertical
His handwriting slopes backwards.

data.chText: 这房子已经很旧，墙都歪了。
data.enText: It was a very old house with sloping walls.
to go somewhere quietly, especially in order to avoid sth/sb

data.chText: 他们等他等得不耐烦，就悄悄走了。
data.enText: They got bored waiting for him and sloped off .

ex.chText: 只有当这架望远镜以30度角倾斜时，你才能看到那颗星星。
ex.enText: Only when the telescope is inclined at an angle of thirty degrees can you see that star.

ex.chText: 墙好像倾斜了将近15度角。
ex.enText: The wall seems to incline almost fifteen degrees.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物以某种角度或向某一方向倾斜。

ex.chText: 他身体前倾，想听他们在谈论什么。
ex.enText: He leaned forward and tried to catch what they were talking about.

ex.chText: 她正倚着一棵树等她男朋友。
ex.enText: She was leaning against a tree, waiting for her boyfriend.

ex.chText: 别把自行车斜靠在门上。
ex.enText: Don't lean your bicycle against the door.

synonyms.bx: 指某人身体前倾或某物倾斜，也可指（使）人或物倚靠在另一人或物之上。

ex.enText: Rays of the sun slanted through the window.

ex.chText: 他把滑雪板略微向右斜了一点。
ex.enText: He slanted his skis a little more to the right.

synonyms.bx: 指某物歪斜或使某物产生一定的角度。

ex.chText: 浴室的地面向排水口倾斜。
ex.enText: The floor of the bathroom slopes down to the drain.
The road slopes sharply at this point.

synonyms.bx: 指地面或其他表面倾斜。

ex.enText: She tilted her head and smiled.

ex.chText: 你可以看见他的嘴角微微翘起。
ex.enText: You can see his mouth tilt upwards slightly at the corners.
The little boy tilted his chair back.

synonyms.bx: 尤指头、下巴等身体部位倾斜或使其倾斜。

data.enText: the/a slippery slope

data.chText: 使人滑向深渊的斜坡；危险的境地
data.enText: a course of action that is difficult to stop once it has begun, and can lead to serious problems or disaster

tr: the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the horizontal

example: the house was built on the side of a mountain

value.def: A slope is the side of a mountain, hill, or valley.

example.ex: Saint-Christo is perched on a mountain slope.
example.tran: 圣克里斯托教堂坐落在一个山坡上。
喜马拉雅山脉较低处的山坡

value.def: A slope is a surface that is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The street must have been on a slope.
example.tran: 这条街一定是建在一个斜坡上。

value.def: If a surface slopes, it is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The bank sloped down sharply to the river...
example.tran: 河岸到河面的斜坡非常陡。

example.ex: ...a brick building, with a sloping roof.

value.def: If something slopes, it leans to the right or to the left rather than being upright.

example.ex: He wonders why the digits on his calculator slope to the right.
example.tran: 他不明白为什么他的计算器上面的数字向右倾斜。

value.def: The slope of something is the angle at which it slopes.

example.ex: The slope increases as you go up the curve.
example.tran: 上了弯道以后，路越来越陡。
一段坡度为 10° 的斜坡

value.def: If someone slopes into or out of a place, they enter or leave it quickly and quietly, especially because they are trying to avoid or escape something.

example.ex: She sloped off quietly on Saturday afternoon...
example.tran: 星期六下午，她脚底抹油，溜之大吉。

example.ex: They sloped into their hotel at 6am.
example.tran: 凌晨 6 点，他们悄悄地潜入他们下榻的饭店。

trans: 边坡稳定；边坡稳定性；边坡稳定分析；土坡稳定；土坡稳定性
岩质边坡；石流坡；岩石边坡
斜角；倾角；倾斜角；坡角；边帮角
阿拉斯加北坡；北坡；北坡油田；阿拉斯加北斯洛普；北斯洛普
滑坡；斜坡破坏；边帮破坏；边坡破坏；斜坡崩塌
斜率效率；线性度测试；斜率；斜率效能；斜度效率
不稳定斜坡；不稳定边坡
